description:
Count Oppenheimer was an Imperial noble and admiral who served as chief of the military police under Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV]. During the Imperial Civil War of 797 UC, he sided with the http://anidb.net/ch6230 [Lippstadt Alliance]; he later claimed he hadn`t wished to participate, but was obliged to due to his blood relation to http://anidb.net/ch303 [Wilhelm von Littenheim].
Following the war, http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] was prepared to give Oppenheimer his previous position back; however, after Oppenheimer attempted to bribe him with a famous Erlemeier painting, Lohengramm had him arrested.
Source: Gineipaedia
name: Oppenheimer
